intro: Dracaena silvatica, commonly known as the mountain dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the high altitudes of Africa, particularly in regions such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the top of the plant. Dracaena silvatica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
